channel.title: Trying to add something and not compiling

item.title: Trying to add something and not compiling
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:5, topic:372997”]You must have something that (FULL) will print out…

Like this for an example…

iif (cmd.equals(“name”)) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“This Info Has Been Stored In Our Database”);
Server.logName(getUsername(), affectedPlayer.getCurrentIP());
}
the methods is already added into RSCD source, so that will actually print out the username of the charatcher and IP the user has…

I think you get it…[/quote]

I spoke to him on MSN about his issue. He doesn’t want the IP of the affectedPlayer. What he wanted to do was create a command, which players can use to add their own ‘real name’ to a text file. Basically, writing a few strings to text file.

Example:

logName(playerUsername, firstName, lastName);
String playerUsername = player.getUsername();
String firstName = args[0]; String lastName = args[1];
::name Yong Min

Read full topic

player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“This Info Has Been Stored In Our Database”);

I think you get it…

item.title: Trying to add something and not compiling
item.dc:creator: @Intoxication Intoxication
item.description:
@Intoxication wrote:

if (cmd.equals(“name”)) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“This Info Has Been Stored In Our Database”);
Server.logName(player, first, last, full);

}

Ok… How is it grabbing the users name? How/where did the user define his/her name?
You’re seeing “null, null” because there’s no information to output.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to add something and not compiling
item.dc:creator: @imsocruel imsocruel
item.description:
@imsocruel wrote:

[code]public static void logName(Player player, String first, String last, String full) {
try {
BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/” + “names.txt”, true));
full = first + last;
output.write("This Is " + player.getUsername() " The Real Name Is " + full);
output.newLine();

		output.newLine();
		output.flush();
		output.close();
	} catch (IOException exception) {
		System.out.println(exception.getMessage());
	}
}[/code]

that is what im trying to add… this was yong mings code but i edited a little to try and log peoples names.

here is the command

if (cmd.equals("name")) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("This Info Has Been Stored In Our Database"); Server.logName(player, first, last, full); }

what am i doing wrong?

I ADDED SOME STRINGS TO COMMAND HANDLER

String first, last, full

GOT IT COMPILING AND WHEN I USE ::NAME HAHA HA I GET THIS IN THE NAMES.TXT

This Is (the user) The Real Name Is nullnull

how do i fix the nullnull

Read full topic
